intro: Chaerophyllum caucasicum, commonly known as the Caucasian cow-wheat, is a flowering plant native to the Caucasus region. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant features finely divided, feather-like leaves and small, yellowish-green flowers that bloom in early summer. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its botanical characteristics make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
